abstract: A New York Fed report on the perception of one's own credit card debt.
snippet: A New York Fed report on the perception of one's own credit card debt.
lead_paragraph: Households underreport the magnitude of their credit card debts by at least one-third, according to a New York Fed study. In fact, borrowers reported owing only about 50 cents for each dollar claimed by credit card lenders, Binyamin Appelbaum reports on the Economix blog.

headline.main: How Much Do You Owe? Guess Again
